net.myorb.math.computational

Class IterativeIntegralApproximation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.myorb.math.computational.IterativeProcessingSupport<T>
      • net.myorb.math.computational.IterativeProcessingSupportTabular<T>
        • net.myorb.math.computational.IterativeIntegralApproximation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of component values on which operations are to be executed

    public class IterativeIntegralApproximation<T>
extends IterativeProcessingSupportTabular<T>
    calculate function integral with iterative increase in precision. Use Trapezoid rule with a double of sample count for each iteration
    Author:
    Michael Druckman

      • initializeRange

        public void initializeRange(T lo,
                            T hi)
        initialize parameters related to range
        Parameters:
        lo - the lo bound of the integration range
        hi - the hi bound of the integration range

      • initializeSum

        public void initializeSum()
        initial sum includes HALF * (f (lo) + f (hi)) + f (lo + halfTick); where tick is (hi - lo)

      • setTick

        public T setTick(T tick)
        calculate center spots between previous ticks
        Parameters:
        tick - the distance of the space to be divided
        Returns:
        lo + halfTick

        public T halfDeltaX()
        Returns:
        (hi - lo) / (2*N)

      • setCurrentApproximation

        public void setCurrentApproximation()
        approximation = sum * deltaX / 2 deltaX = (hi - lo) / N

      • execute

      • executeIteration

        public T executeIteration(T x)
        execute a single iteration doubling the sample size
        Parameters:
        x - first tick value of new iteration (with new halfTick value)
        Returns:
        sum of iteration of half tick points
